Legal_Issue: Existence of an internal flight alternative (IFA) and credibility of applicant's claim
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant misrepresented her situation upon entry
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, lack of documentary proof of spousal violence and state protection failure
Basis_of_Claim: Domestic violence and fear of deportation
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of evidence proving inability to relocate within Hungary
Application_Error: Misrepresentation of circumstances upon entry to Canada
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to IFA determination
Legal_Standard: Burden on applicant to prove no reasonable IFA exists
Application_Factor: Fear of deportation and claimed lack of state protection in Hungary
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim rejected due to existence of IFA
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the panel erred in finding an IFA without considering specific circumstances
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA regarding internal flight alternative
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicant's misrepresentation and failure to demonstrate no viable IFA
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support claims of spousal violence and lack of state protection
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's account deemed inconsistent or unreliable
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim that panel failed to consider personal circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review for IFA decisions
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose true circumstances at entry
